TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ImageFieldValue extends Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Fields.HtmlTagValue

Docs.summary: A field value class for an object that represents an IMG tag and specific key attributes for that tag.

remarks.para: This value object wraps an HTML string for an image and allows you to get and set certain value object properties and then get the resulting tag HTML markup string. If the property does not have a value, then the method returns an empty string. In other cases, the ToString method returns a string of HTML that contains an tag, possibly enclosed in an tag hyperlink, depending on the values of its property. Only certain properties are recognized on the and tags and are used to generate the HTML string.

For an ImageField column, instances are usually retrieved from an field value. SPListItem is also used to store the posted value in a RichImageField and RichImageSelector control. Additionally, you can construct a new instance directly as an empty value or a value based on an HTML string that conforms to the basic pattern of an tag optionally enclosed in an tag. After you retrieve this value from an SPListItem field and change any properties on this object, you must set the value object back to the SPListItem field value and update it to store the value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a new empty instance of a object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string inputHtml) cil managed

Docs.param: HTML string containing an tag with a src attribute. Optionally includes other recognized attributes.
Docs.summary: Constructs a new instance of a object using an tag in the parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Alignment { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Alignment : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the Image object in relation to other elements on the Web page.
Docs.value: The alignment of the Image in relation to other elements on the Web page.Default is an empty string.

remarks.para: The value of this property is the attribute in the tag in the method output.
Valid values for alignment include , , , and .

example.para: Note: This example is part of the larger ImageFieldValue sample in the topic.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ AlternateText { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.AlternateText : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the alternate text that appears as an image tooltip or when the image is unavailable.

remarks.para: The value of this property is the attribute in the tag in the method output.

example.para: Note: This example is part of the larger ImageFieldValue sample in the topic.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int BorderWidth { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.BorderWidth : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the width of the border around the image.
Docs.value: The width of the border around the image. The default is 0.

remarks.para: If this value is greater than 0, a solid border of the specified width is rendered around the image.
The value of this property is the attribute in the tag in the method output.

example.para: Note: This example is part of the larger ImageFieldValue sample in the topic.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Height { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.Height : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the explicit height, in pixels, used to allow a Web browser to scale the image.

remarks.para: If this value is greater than 0, then a height attribute is added to the tag. If the value is set to 0 or less, no height attribute is used and the image retains its default height.

example.para: Note: This example is part of the larger ImageFieldValue sample in the topic.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int HorizontalSpacing { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.HorizontalSpacing : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal spacing, in pixels, on the right and left side of the image.
Docs.value: The horizontal spacing on the left and right, in pixels. Default is 0.

remarks.para: The value of this property is the attribute of the tag in the method output.

example.para: Note: This example is part of the larger ImageFieldValue sample in the topic.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Hyperlink { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Hyperlink : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL for the optional hyperlink on this image.
Docs.value: The URL for a hyperlink around this image.Default is an empty string, which means that the image has no hyperlink <A> tag.

remarks.para: You can set the URL in this property to any URL reference, although some invalid values may be removed when the value is stored in a field value.
The value of this property is the attribute of an tag that surrounds an tag in the method output.

example.para: Note: This example is part of the larger ImageFieldValue sample in the topic.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ImageUrl { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ImageUrl : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the image for this object.
Docs.value: The URL of the image for this ImageFieldValue object. Default is an empty string, which means that the entire value is considered empty.The value of this property is the attribute of the tag in the ToString output.

remarks.para: This property can be any absolute or server-relative image reference, although some invalid values may be removed when the value is stored in an field value.
This is the primary data element for this field value. If this URL does not have a value, all other data in this object is ignored and the method returns an empty string.

example.para: Note: This example is part of the larger ImageFieldValue sample in the topic.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool OpenHyperlinkInNewWindow { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.OpenHyperlinkInNewWindow : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that determines whether to open an image hyperlink URL in a new window when the link is clicked.
Docs.value: A Boolean value that determines whether any image hyperlink URL opens in a new window.If set to True, any image hyperlink URL opens in a new window. Otherwise, set to False.Default is False.

remarks.para: A True value means that a attribute appears on any hyperlink <A> tag in the method output.

example.para: Note: This example is part of the larger ImageFieldValue sample in the topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed
Public Overrides Function ToString () As String

Docs.summary: Returns an HTML string with an tag with properties as they are currently set in this object.
Docs.returns: An HTML string with an tag with properties as they are currently set in this object.

remarks.para: If the property does not have a value, this method returns an empty string. Otherwise, this method returns an HTML string that contains an tag, possibly enclosed in an tag hyperlink, depending on the values of the Hyperlink property. Only certain properties are recognized on the and tags and used to generate the HTML string.

example.para: Note: This example is part of the larger ImageFieldValue sample in the topic.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int VerticalSpacing { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.VerticalSpacing : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the vertical spacing, in pixels, on the top and bottom of the image.
Docs.value: The vertical spacing on the top and bottom of the image, in pixels. Default is 0.

remarks.para: The value of this property is the attribute of the tag in the output of the method.

example.para: Note: This example is part of the larger ImageFieldValue sample in the topic.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Width { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.Width : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the explicit width, in pixels, that can be used to allow a Web browser to scale the image.
Docs.value: The explicit width in pixels used to allow a Web browser to scale the image. Default is 0.

remarks.para: If this value is greater than 0, a attribute is added to the tag that is output. If it is set to 0 or less, no width attribute is used and the image retains its default width.

example.para: Note: This example is part of the larger ImageFieldValue sample in the topic.
